/address/info.description: Get address payment credential and stake address, along with its current aggregate lovelace and multi asset balance. Either `address` or `paymentCred` can be provided, but one must be provided.

parameters.description: Address to query for
parameters.name: address

parameters.description: Payment credential to query for
parameters.name: paymentCred

/address/utxos.description: Get current UTxOs at an address/payment credential. Either `address` or `paymentCred` can be provided, but one must be provided.

parameters.description: Address to query for
parameters.name: address

parameters.description: Payment credential to query for
parameters.name: paymentCred

parameters.description: This endpoint supports pagination. Default page is `1`.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Specify how many items to return per page. Maximum is `100`, default is `100`.
parameters.name: perPage

/asset/supply.description: Get onchain supply for a token.

parameters.description: Token unit (policy + hex name) to filter by
parameters.name: unit

/integration/asset.description: Returns details of a given token by its address.

parameters.description: Token ID
parameters.name: id

/integration/block.description: Returns a specific block using either the number of the block or its timestamp.

parameters.description: Block number
parameters.name: number

parameters.description: Block timestamp
parameters.name: timestamp

/integration/events.description: List of events occured in a range of blocks.

parameters.description: Block number to start filtering at (inclusive).
parameters.name: fromBlock

parameters.description: Block number to end filtering at (inclusive).
parameters.name: toBlock

parameters.description: Limit results to a maximum count, Defaults to `1000`, With a maximum of `1000`.
parameters.name: limit

/integration/exchange.description: Return details of a given DEX by its factory address or alternative id.

parameters.description: Exchange id
parameters.name: id

/integration/latest-block.description: Returns the latest block processed in the blockchain/DEX.

/integration/pair.description: Returns pair details (aka pool) by its address.

parameters.description: Pair ID
parameters.name: id

/market/stats.description: Get aggregated market stats, including 24h DEX volume and total active addresses onchain. Active addresses are addresses that have either sent or received any transactions within the last 24 hours. Multiple addresses with the same stake key will be counted as one address.

parameters.description: Quote currency to use (ADA, USD, EUR, ETH, BTC). Default is `ADA`.
parameters.name: quote

/metrics.description: Get the number of requests made by day over the last 30d.

/nft/asset/sales.description: Get a specific asset's sale history.

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

parameters.description: The name of a specific NFT to get stats for.
parameters.name: name

/nft/asset/stats.description: Get high-level stats on a certain NFT asset.

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

parameters.description: The name of a specific NFT to get stats for.
parameters.name: name

/nft/asset/traits.description: Get a specific NFT's traits and trait prices.

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

parameters.description: The name of a specific NFT to get stats for.
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: Include trait prices or not, Options are `0`, `1`. Default is `1`.
parameters.name: prices

/nft/collection/assets.description: Get all NFTs from a collection with the ability to sort by price/rank and filter to specific traits. Categories and traits can be searched for by adding query params ex:(`policy=abc&hair=white,black&background=red`), you can have any combination of categories and traits ex:(`policy=abc&hair=blonde&background=blue`)

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

parameters.description: What should the results be sorted by. Options are `price` and `rank`. Default is `price`.
parameters.name: sortBy

parameters.description: Which direction should the results be sorted. Options are `asc`, `desc`. Default is `asc`
parameters.name: order

parameters.description: Search for a certain NFT's name, default is `null`.
parameters.name: search

parameters.description: Return only nfts that are on sale Options are `0`, `1`. Default is `0`.
parameters.name: onSale

parameters.description: This endpoint supports pagination. Default page is `1`.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Specify how many items to return per page. Maximum is `100`, default is `100`.
parameters.name: perPage

/nft/collection/holders/distribution.description: Get the distribution of NFTs within a collection by bucketing into number of NFTs held groups. This counts someone who has an asset listed on a marketplace as an owner, as well as someone who is staking their NFT to a supported smart contract.

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

/nft/collection/holders/top.description: Get the top holders for a particular NFT collection. This counts someone who has an asset listed on a marketplace as an owner, as well as someone who is staking their NFT to a supported smart contract.

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

parameters.description: This endpoint supports pagination. Default page is `1`.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Specify how many items to return per page. Maximum is `100`, default is `10`.
parameters.name: perPage

parameters.description: Whether or not to exclude marketplace addresses (0, 1)
parameters.name: excludeExchanges

/nft/collection/holders/trended.description: Get holders trended by day for a particular NFT collection. This counts someone who has an asset listed on a marketplace as an owner, as well as someone who is staking their NFT to a supported smart contract.

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

parameters.description: The time interval. Options are `7d`, `30d`, `90d`, `180d`, `1y` and `all`. Defaults to `30d`.
parameters.name: timeframe

/nft/collection/info.description: Get basic information about a collection like name, socials, and logo.

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

/nft/collection/listings.description: Get the amount of active listings along with total supply for a particular collection.

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

/nft/collection/listings/depth.description: Get cumulative amount of listings at each price point, starting at the floor and moving upwards.

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

parameters.description: Specify how many items to return. Maximum is `1000`, default is `500`.
parameters.name: items

/nft/collection/listings/individual.description: Get a list of active listings with supporting information. This endpoint supports pagination and sorting by price and time listed.

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

parameters.description: What should the results be sorted by. Options are `price`, `time`. Default is `price`.
parameters.name: sortBy

parameters.description: Which direction should the results be sorted. Options are `asc`, `desc`. Default is `asc`
parameters.name: order

parameters.description: This endpoint supports pagination. Default page is `1`.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Specify how many items to return per page. Maximum is `100`, default is `100`.
parameters.name: perPage

/nft/collection/listings/trended.description: Get trended number of listings and floor price for a particular NFT collection.

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

parameters.description: The time interval. Options are `3m`, `5m`, `15m`, `30m`, `1h`, `2h`, `4h`, `12h`, `1d`, `3d`, `1w`, `1M`.
parameters.name: interval

parameters.description: The number of intervals to return, e.g. if you want 180 days of data in 1d intervals, then pass `180` here. Leave blank for full history.
parameters.name: numIntervals

/nft/collection/ohlcv.description: Get OHLCV (open, high, low, close, volume) of floor price for a particular NFT collection. If you don't plan to format with candlesticks, you can use the `close` value from each interval and create a simple line chart. `time` is the start time of the interval, as a UNIX timestamp.

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

parameters.description: The time interval. Options are `3m`, `5m`, `15m`, `30m`, `1h`, `2h`, `4h`, `12h`, `1d`, `3d`, `1w`, `1M`.
parameters.name: interval

parameters.description: The number of intervals to return, e.g. if you want 180 days of data in 1d intervals, then pass `180` here.
parameters.name: numIntervals

/nft/collection/stats.description: Get basic information about a collection like floor price, volume, and supply. Volume returned is lifetime volume. Use `/nft/collection/trades/stats` for different timeframes and more information about trading volume.

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

/nft/collection/stats/extended.description: Get basic information about a collection like floor price, volume, and supply. Volume returned is lifetime volume. `pctChg` values are the percentage difference between current values and value up until timeframe. This returns the same data as `nft/collection/stats`, but with percent changes included.

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

parameters.description: The time interval. Options are `24h`, `7d`, `30d`. Defaults to `24h`.
parameters.name: timeframe

/nft/collection/trades.description: Get individual trades for a particular collection or for the entire NFT market by not specifying a policy ID.

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

parameters.description: The time interval. Options are `1h`, `4h`, `24h`, `7d`, `30d`, `90d`, `180d`, `1y`, `all`. Defaults to `30d`.
parameters.name: timeframe

parameters.description: What should the results be sorted by. Options are `amount`, `time`. Default is `time`.
parameters.name: sortBy

parameters.description: Which direction should the results be sorted. Options are `asc`, `desc`. Default is `desc`.
parameters.name: order

parameters.description: Filter to only trades of a certain ADA amount.
parameters.name: minAmount

parameters.description: Filter trades using a UNIX timestamp, will only return trades after this timestamp.
parameters.name: from

parameters.description: This endpoint supports pagination. Default page is `1`.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Specify how many items to return per page. Maximum is `100`, default is `100`.
parameters.name: perPage

/nft/collection/trades/stats.description: Get trading stats like volume and number of sales for a particular collection.

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

parameters.description: What timeframe to include in volume aggregation. Options are `1h`, `4h`, `24h`, `7d`, `30d`, `all`. Defaults to `24h`.
parameters.name: timeframe

/nft/collection/traits/price.description: Get a list of traits within a collection and each trait's floor price. This allows you to see which traits are higher/lower priced.

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

parameters.description: The name of a specific NFT to get trait prices for.
parameters.name: name

/nft/collection/traits/rarity.description: Get every metadata attribute and how likely it is to occur within the NFT collection.

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

/nft/collection/traits/rarity/rank.description: Get rank of NFT's rarity within a collection

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

parameters.description: The name of the NFT
parameters.name: name

/nft/collection/volume/trended.description: Get trended volume and number of sales for a particular NFT collection.

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

parameters.description: The time interval. Options are `3m`, `5m`, `15m`, `30m`, `1h`, `2h`, `4h`, `12h`, `1d`, `3d`, `1w`, `1M`.
parameters.name: interval

parameters.description: The number of intervals to return, e.g. if you want 180 days of data in 1d intervals, then pass `180` here. Leave blank for full history.
parameters.name: numIntervals

/nft/market/stats.description: Get high-level market stats across the entire NFT market. `addresses` is the count of stake keys that have purchased or sold an NFT within the given timeframe. If an address does not have a stake key, it is still counted as a distinct address.

parameters.description: The time interval. Options are `1h`, `4h`, `24h`, `7d`, `30d`, `all`. Defaults to `24h`.
parameters.name: timeframe

/nft/market/stats/extended.description: Get high-level market stats across the entire NFT market. `addresses` is the count of stake keys that have purchased or sold an NFT within the given timeframe. If an address does not have a stake key, it is still counted as a distinct address.

parameters.description: The time interval. Options are `1h`, `4h`, `24h`, `7d`, `30d`, `all`. Defaults to `24h`.
parameters.name: timeframe

/nft/market/volume/trended.description: Get trended volume for entire NFT market.

parameters.description: The time interval. Options are `7d`, `30d`, `90d`, `180d`, `1y`, `all`. Defaults to `30d`.
parameters.name: timeframe

parameters.description: The time interval. Options are `24h`, `7d`, `30d`, `90d`, `180d`, `all`. Defaults to `7d`.
parameters.name: timeframe

parameters.description: Filters data to a certain marketplace by name.
parameters.name: marketplace

parameters.description: Filters to only count data that occured between yesterday 00:00UTC and today 00:00UTC `(0,1)`.
parameters.name: lastDay

/nft/top/timeframe.description: Get top NFT rankings based on total market cap, 24 hour volume or 24 hour top price gainers/losers.

parameters.description: Criteria to rank NFT Collections based on. Options are `marketCap`, `volume`, `gainers`, `losers`.
parameters.name: ranking

parameters.description: Specify how many items to return. Maximum is `100`, default is `25`.
parameters.name: items

/nft/top/volume.description: Get top NFT collections by trading volume over a given timeframe.

parameters.description: What timeframe to include in volume aggregation. Options are `1h`, `4h`, `24h`, `7d`, `30d`, `all`. Defaults to `24h`.
parameters.name: timeframe

parameters.description: This endpoint supports pagination. Default page is `1`.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Specify how many items to return per page. Maximum is `100`, default is `10`.
parameters.name: perPage

/nft/top/volume/extended.description: Get top NFT collections by trading volume over a given timeframe. `pctChg` values are the percentage difference between current values and values up until the given `timeframe`.

parameters.description: What timeframe to include in volume aggregation. Options are `1h`, `4h`, `24h`, `7d`, `30d`, `all`. Defaults to `24h`.
parameters.name: timeframe

parameters.description: This endpoint supports pagination. Default page is `1`.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Specify how many items to return per page. Maximum is `100`, default is `10`.
parameters.name: perPage

/token/debt/loans.description: Get active P2P loans of a certain token (Currently only supports P2P protocols like Lenfi and Levvy).

parameters.description: Token unit (policy + hex name) to filter by
parameters.name: unit

parameters.description: Comma seperated value enabling you to filter to loans where token is used as `collateral`, `debt`, `interest` or a mix of them, default is `collateral,debt` filtering to loans where token is used as collateral OR debt.
parameters.name: include

parameters.description: What should the results be sorted by. Options are `time`, `expiration`. Default is `time`. `expiration` is expiration date of loan.
parameters.name: sortBy

parameters.description: Which direction should the results be sorted. Options are `asc`, `desc`. Default is `desc`.
parameters.name: order

parameters.description: This endpoint supports pagination. Default page is `1`.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Specify how many items to return per page, default is `100`.
parameters.name: perPage

/token/debt/offers.description: Get active P2P loan offers that are not associated with any loans yet (Currently only supports P2P protocols like Lenfi and Levvy).

parameters.description: Token unit (policy + hex name) to filter by
parameters.name: unit

parameters.description: Comma seperated value enabling you to filter to offers where token is used as `collateral`, `debt`, `interest` or a mix of them, default is `collateral,debt` filtering to offers where token is used as collateral OR debt.
parameters.name: include

parameters.description: What should the results be sorted by. Options are `time`, `duration`. Default is `time`. `duration` is loan duration in seconds.
parameters.name: sortBy

parameters.description: Which direction should the results be sorted. Options are `asc`, `desc`. Default is `desc`.
parameters.name: order

parameters.description: This endpoint supports pagination. Default page is `1`.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Specify how many items to return per page, default is `100`.
parameters.name: perPage

/token/holders.description: Get total number of holders for a specific token. This uses `coalesce(stake_address, address)`, so all addresses under one stake key will be aggregated into 1 holder.

parameters.description: Token unit (policy + hex name)
parameters.name: unit

parameters.description: Token unit (policy + hex name)
parameters.name: unit

parameters.description: This endpoint supports pagination. Default page is `1`.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Specify how many items to return per page. Maximum is `100`, default is `20`.
parameters.name: perPage

/token/indicators.description: Get indicator values (e.g. EMA, RSI) based on price data for a specific token. There are multiple parameters that can be passed, but some only apply to certain indicators. This will return the most recent values.

parameters.description: Token unit (policy + hex name)
parameters.name: unit

parameters.description: The time interval. Options are `3m`, `5m`, `15m`, `30m`, `1h`, `2h`, `4h`, `12h`, `1d`, `3d`, `1w`, `1M`.
parameters.name: interval

parameters.description: The number of items to return. The maximum number of items that can be returned is 1000.
parameters.name: items

parameters.description: Specify which indicator to use. Options are `ma`, `ema`, `rsi`, `macd`, `bb`, `bbw`.
parameters.name: indicator

parameters.description: Length of data to include. Used in `ma`, `ema`, `rsi`, `bb`, and `bbw`.
parameters.name: length

parameters.description: Length of data to include for smoothing. Used in `ema`. Most often is set to 2.
parameters.name: smoothingFactor

parameters.description: Length of shorter EMA to use in MACD. Only used in `macd`
parameters.name: fastLength

parameters.description: Length of longer EMA to use in MACD. Only used in `macd`
parameters.name: slowLength

parameters.description: Length of signal EMA to use in MACD. Only used in `macd`
parameters.name: signalLength

parameters.description: Standard deviation multiplier to use for upper and lower bands of Bollinger Bands (typically set to 2). Used in `bb` and `bbw`.
parameters.name: stdMult

parameters.description: Which quote currency to use when building price data (e.g. `ADA`, `USD`).
parameters.name: quote

/token/links.description: Get a specific token's social links, if they have been provided to TapTools.

parameters.description: Token unit (policy + hex name)
parameters.name: unit

/token/mcap.description: Get a specific token's supply and market cap information. We pull circulating supply information from [this repo](https://github.com/minswap/market-cap).

parameters.description: Token unit (policy + hex name)
parameters.name: unit

/token/ohlcv.description: Get a specific token's trended (`open`, `high`, `low`, `close`, `volume`) price data. You can either pass a token unit to get aggregated data across all liquidity pools, or an `onchainID` for a specific pair (see `/token/pools`).

parameters.description: Token unit (policy + hex name)
parameters.name: unit

parameters.description: Pair onchain ID to get ohlc data for
parameters.name: onchainID

parameters.description: The time interval. Options are `3m`, `5m`, `15m`, `30m`, `1h`, `2h`, `4h`, `12h`, `1d`, `3d`, `1w`, `1M`.
parameters.name: interval

parameters.description: The number of intervals to return, e.g. if you want 180 days of data in 1d intervals, then pass `180` here.
parameters.name: numIntervals

/token/pools.description: Get a specific token's active liquidity pools. Can search for all token pools using `unit` or can search for specific pool with `onchainID`.

parameters.description: Token unit (policy + hex name)
parameters.name: unit

parameters.description: Liquidity pool onchainID
parameters.name: onchainID

parameters.description: Return only ADA pools or all pools (0, 1)
parameters.name: adaOnly

/token/prices.description: Get an object with token units (policy + hex name) as keys and price as values for a list of policies and hex names. These prices are aggregated across all supported DEXs. Max batch size is `100` tokens.

/token/prices/chg.description: Get a specific token's price percent change over various timeframes. Timeframe options include `[5m, 1h, 4h, 6h, 24h, 7d, 30d, 60d, 90d]`. All timeframes are returned by default.

parameters.description: Token unit (policy + hex name)
parameters.name: unit

parameters.description: List of timeframes
parameters.name: timeframes

/token/quote.description: Get current quote price (e.g, current ADA/USD price).

parameters.description: Quote currency to use (USD, EUR, ETH, BTC). Default is `USD`.
parameters.name: quote

/token/quote/available.description: Get all currently available quote currencies.

/token/top/liquidity.description: Get tokens ranked by their DEX liquidity. This includes both AMM and order book liquidity.

parameters.description: This endpoint supports pagination. Default page is `1`.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Specify how many items to return per page. Maximum is `100`, default is `10`.
parameters.name: perPage

/token/top/mcap.description: Get tokens with top market cap in a descending order. This endpoint does exclude deprecated tokens (e.g. MELD V1 since there was a token migration to MELD V2).

parameters.description: Sort tokens by circulating market cap or fully diluted value. Options `[mcap, fdv]`.
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: This endpoint supports pagination. Default page is `1`.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Specify how many items to return per page. Maximum is `100`, default is `20`.
parameters.name: perPage

/token/top/volume.description: Get tokens with top volume for a given timeframe.

parameters.description: Specify a timeframe in which to aggregate the data by. Options are `[1h, 4h, 12h, 24h, 7d, 30d, 180d, 1y, all]`. Default is `24h`.
parameters.name: timeframe

parameters.description: This endpoint supports pagination. Default page is `1`.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Specify how many items to return per page. Maximum is `100`, default is `20`.
parameters.name: perPage

/token/trades.description: Get token trades across the entire DEX market.

parameters.description: The time interval. Options are `1h`, `4h`, `24h`, `7d`, `30d`, `90d`, `180d`, `1y`, `all`. Defaults to `30d`.
parameters.name: timeframe

parameters.description: What should the results be sorted by. Options are `amount`, `time`. Default is `amount`. Filters to only ADA trades if set to `amount`.
parameters.name: sortBy

parameters.description: Which direction should the results be sorted. Options are `asc`, `desc`. Default is `desc`.
parameters.name: order

parameters.description: Optionally filter to a specific token by specifying a token unit (policy + hex name).
parameters.name: unit

parameters.description: Filter to only trades of a certain ADA amount.
parameters.name: minAmount

parameters.description: Filter trades using a UNIX timestamp, will only return trades after this timestamp.
parameters.name: from

parameters.description: This endpoint supports pagination. Default page is `1`.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Specify how many items to return per page. Maximum is `100`, default is `10`.
parameters.name: perPage

/token/trading/stats.description: Get aggregated trading stats for a particular token.

parameters.description: Token unit (policy + hex name)
parameters.name: unit

parameters.description: Specify a timeframe in which to aggregate the data by. Options are `[15m, 1h, 4h, 12h, 24h, 7d, 30d, 90d, 180d, 1y, all]`. Default is `24h`.
parameters.name: timeframe

/transaction/utxos.description: Get UTxOs from a specific transaction.

parameters.description: Transaction hash
parameters.name: hash

/wallet/portfolio/positions.description: Get wallet's current portfolio positions with supporting market data. This includes positions that are staked in a smart contract and LP farm positions (for supported protocols)

parameters.description: Address to query for
parameters.name: address

/wallet/trades/tokens.description: Get the token trade history for a particular wallet. Optionally pass a token unit to filter to a specific token.

parameters.description: Address to query for
parameters.name: address

parameters.description: Token unit (policy + hex name) to filter by
parameters.name: unit

/wallet/value/trended.description: Get historical trended value of an address in 4hr intervals. This includes the value of all tokens, NFTs, LP/farm positions, custodial staking, and assets involved in active loans (either being lent or used as collateral). **NOTE** this does not include staking rewards unless the rewards are withdrew from rewards account.

parameters.description: Address to query for
parameters.name: address

parameters.description: The time interval. Options are `24h`, `7d`, `30d`, `90d`, `180d`, `1y`, `all`. Defaults to `30d`.
parameters.name: timeframe

parameters.description: Quote currency to use (ADA, USD, EUR, ETH, BTC). Default is `ADA`.
parameters.name: quote
